hero.headline:
Your traffic is worth more
than your conversion rate suggests
hero.description: Zero-click searches own 60-70% of queries. AI overviews cut CTR by ~35%. The visitors who do land on your site are fewer, but they're ready to act — if your site lets them. We run CRO programs that treat every page as a revenue conversation, not a brochure.

problems.title: Traffic without conversion is a vanity metric.

items.title: High traffic, flat pipeline
items.description: You're driving visitors, but the numbers that matter — demo starts, form submissions, qualified leads — haven't moved. Your dashboard shows growth. Your pipeline says otherwise.

items.title: Design-first, conversion-second
items.description: Your site won design awards or internal applause, but nobody built it to convert. Layouts optimized for aesthetics, not comprehension. Copy that describes features instead of solving problems. No clear path from landing to action.

items.title: Random tests, no system
items.description: Someone ran an A/B test on a button color six months ago. That's the CRO program. No hypothesis framework, no prioritization, no connection between what you're testing and what actually moves revenue.

approach.title: CRO as a system, not experiments
approach.intro: We don't run isolated A/B tests and call it optimization. Every page, layout decision, and line of copy gets evaluated through one filter: Does this build confidence? Reduce friction? Move the visitor toward a decision?

steps.title: Conversion audit
steps.description: We map your current funnel: where visitors land, where they drop off, where friction kills momentum. Every finding scored against revenue impact, not statistical curiosity.

steps.title: 90-day roadmap
steps.description: 3-5 measurable goals tied to pipeline outcomes. A shared Scoreboard tracking conversion rate, demo starts, form submissions, and scroll depth. Clear priorities so nothing gets tested at random.

steps.title: Continuous testing
steps.description: Headlines, CTAs, page structure, forms, social proof placement — tested systematically alongside your SEO/AEO program. As traffic scales, conversion rates improve in parallel. The compound effect is where the ROI lives.

steps.title: Weekly showcase
steps.description: A live walkthrough of what shipped, how conversion metrics moved, and what's next. Every test tied to business outcomes your exec team cares about — not statistical noise.

items.title: Conversion clarity
items.description: Message hierarchy, information architecture, and UX designed for comprehension and decision-making. We structure pages so visitors understand your value in seconds, not minutes.

items.title: Confidence-building design
items.description: Layout, copy, and social proof positioned to reduce buyer hesitation at every stage. Trust indicators, case study placement, and pricing transparency — all engineered to move prospects past "I'll think about it."

items.title: Copy that converts
items.description: Positioning-first copywriting where every word earns its place. Headlines that qualify visitors. CTAs that name the next step. Body copy that builds the case for action instead of filling space.

items.title: Technical performance
items.description: Core Web Vitals, page speed, and mobile responsiveness directly affect conversion. A page that loads in 4 seconds loses 25% of visitors before they see your headline. We treat performance as a conversion lever, not a dev task.

items.title: Data-driven iteration
items.description: Systematic testing tied to a shared Scoreboard. We model conservative forecasts — incremental CRO improvement alongside traffic growth — so you can see exactly when the program pays for itself.

faq.title: Common questions about our CRO program

items.question: How is this different from running A/B tests?
items.answer: A/B testing is a tactic. CRO is the system that decides what to test, why, and how to measure whether it mattered. We build a prioritization framework around your business goals, run tests systematically, and compound the wins — not cherry-pick one-off experiments.

items.question: Do I need a certain amount of traffic for CRO to work?
items.answer: Statistical significance matters, so very low-traffic sites need a different approach. For most B2B sites with 5,000+ monthly visitors, there's enough data to run meaningful tests. Below that threshold, we focus on conversion-oriented design and copy — which doesn't require test data to improve.

items.question: Can CRO work alongside our existing SEO program?
items.answer: That's how it should work. We run CRO and SEO/AEO as integrated tracks — as traffic grows from search, conversion rates improve in parallel. The compound effect is where the real ROI lives. If you're already working with us on SEO/AEO, CRO plugs directly into the same Scoreboard and showcase cadence.

items.question: What metrics do you track?
items.answer: Conversion rate by page and traffic source, demo starts, form submissions, scroll depth on priority pages, time to first meaningful action, and qualified leads from organic. Every metric tied to revenue, not vanity.

items.question: How long before I see results?
items.answer: Quick wins — headline, CTA, and above-the-fold improvements — can move numbers within the first 30 days. Compound gains build over 90-day cycles. We set clear goals at the start and report against them weekly.

items.question: Do I need to manage the testing?
items.answer: No. We own the roadmap, prioritization, execution, and reporting. You get a single point of contact, weekly showcases, and a shared Scoreboard. Zero task management on your end.

cta.subtitle: Let's audit your current conversion funnel and build a program that compounds results alongside your traffic growth.
